a.title: Middle/Senior High School Planned Instruction Site

br.br: The April meeting for the Benton Area School District Board of Directors will be held on Zoom on Monday, April 20th at 6:30p.m. You need to be registered for this meeting to attend, but it is open to the public. The webinar is limited to the first 100 people to register. If you would like to register for the meeting, please click here. If you would like to live stream the meeting, the link for the YouTube live stream event will be posted here at 6:30p.m. the night of the meeting. If you have any questions about registration, please call 570-925-0945.

a.title: PASA Coronavirus & Pandemic Resources
a.style: color: rgb(134, 0, 0); font-family: Arial,sans-serif; font-size: 24px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-decoration: underline; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; word-spacing: 0px;

div.div: An important update from First Columbia Bank & Trust in regards to the 10th Annual First Columbia Teen Star Musical Competition. Please click 'Read More' for the full information.

On Monday, March 16, 2020 the Benton Area School Board took action to terminate participation in the Articles of Agreements with the Columbia Montour Area Vocational Technical School. The School Board Secretary sent letters to the Vo-Tech Director and Business Manager stating our intentions.
Please click Read More for the most up-to-date information on the Coronavirus from the CDC.
The February '20 edition of the Tiger's Roar is out! Check it out under the Schools tab at the top of the page.

a.title: Letter to Parents for the Lycoming Career and Technical Center

div.a: Letter to Parents for the Lycoming Career and Technical Center

div.div: The Benton Area School District Board of Directors is exploring vocational and technical options for the 2020-2021 school year. Students entering 10th grade will have the option to attend the Lycoming Career and Technology Center (LycoCTC) in Hughesville. LycoCTC offers a part-time, two- hour a day vocational program that prepares students for college, military service, and workforce. Click 'Read More' for the full letter.

Parents or Guardians, you may be eligible for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP), which is a program that helps supplement your monthly grocery budget to help put nutritious foods on your family's table. Click 'Read More' for full details or look for the link under the Community tab at the top of the page.

Safe2Say Something is a youth violence prevention program run by the Pennsylvania Office of Attorney General. The program teaches youth and adults how to recognize warning signs and signals, especially within social media, from individuals who may be a threat to themselves or others and to “say something” BEFORE it is too late. With Safe2Say Something, it’s easy and confidential to report safety concerns to help prevent violence and tragedies.

Parents, if you haven't signed up for a Sapphire Community Portal account yet, now is the time to do so! With a Sapphire Community account you can submit required forms online, view your student's progress in classes, and much more. Choose the Sapphire Login under the Quick Links drop down at the top of the page. From there choose the Community Portal option and then click on 'Create a Web Portal account' to get started.

The Benton Area School District's Comprehensive Plan for the 2020-2023 school years is now available and can be accessed by clicking the Read More at the bottom or by going to the District tab > District Information > Comprehensive Plan.

On Wednesday, September 18, 2019, the Benton Area School District held a presentation for Vo-Tech delivery options. The Vocational/Technical Education Study on this topic can be found by clicking Read More.
To read the Benton Area School District Policy 249- Bullying/Cyberbullying, please click Read More.

High school students in Pennsylvania can earn free college credits by participating in the Penn College NOW dual-enrollment program offered by Pennsylvania College of Technology. Click Read More for more information.

The Benton Area School District's mission is to provide an excellent education in order to maximize the potential of all students and prepare them to meet the challenges of work and life in an ever changing world.
Belief Statement
Student learning is the chief priority for the Benton Area School District.
All students can learn.
Each student is a valued individual with unique physical, social, emotional, and intellectual needs.
Students learn in different ways and should be provided with a variety of instructional approaches to support their learning.
Teachers, administrators, parents and the community share the responsibility for advancing the school's mission.
Exceptional students require special services and resources.
Curriculum and instructional practices should incorporate a variety of learning activities to accommodate differences in learning styles.
Ongoing professional development of staff is vital.
Benton Area School District is an equal opportunity educational institution and will not discriminate in its educational programs, activities or employee practices, based on race, color, national origin, gender, age, religion, ancestry, disabling condition, or union membership. The district will make reasonable accommodations for identified physical and mental impairments that constitute disabilities, consistent with the requirements federal and state laws and regulations. Announcement of this policy is in accordance with state and federal laws, including Title VII and IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 and Section 503 and 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1972 and the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1992. Inquiries or complaints should be directed to the Superintendent, Benton Area School District, 600 Green Acres Road, Benton, PA 17814.
